summary.long: Mark is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Just as it is written in the prophet Isaiah,
“Behold, I am sending my messenger before your face,
    who will prepare your way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the voice of one shouting in the wilderness,
    ‘Prepare the way of the Lord,
    make straight his paths!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John was there baptizing in the wilderness, proclaiming a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the Judean region and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem went out to him and were being baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And John was dressed in camel’s hair and a belt made of leather around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was preaching, saying, “One who is more powerful than I is coming after me, of whom I am not worthy to bend down and untie the strap of his sandals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I baptized you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that in those days Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized in the Jordan by John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately as he was coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens being split apart and the Spirit descending like a dove on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a voice came from heaven, “You are my beloved Son; with you I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately the Spirit drove him out into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was in the wilderness forty days being tempted by Satan. And he was with the wild animals, and the angels were ministering to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after John had been taken into custody, Jesus went into Galilee proclaiming the gospel of God
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “The time is fulfilled and the kingdom of God has come near. Repent and believe in the gospel!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And as he was passing by along the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew, Simon’s brother, casting a net into the sea (for they were fishermen).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “Follow me and I will make you become fishers of people.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And immediately they left their nets and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And going on a little farther, he saw James the son of Zebedee and his brother John, and they were in the boat mending the nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and went away after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went into Capernaum and immediately on the Sabbath he began to teach in the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were amazed at his teaching, because he was teaching them like one who had authority, and not like the scribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so then there was a man in their synagogue with an unclean spirit, and he cried out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Leave us alone, Jesus the Nazarene! Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silent, and come out of him!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And after convulsing him and crying out with a loud voice, the unclean spirit came out of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were all amazed, so that they began to discuss with one another, saying, “What is this? A new teaching with authority! He even commands the unclean spirits and they obey him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the report about him then went out everywhere in the whole surrounding region of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so then he departed from the synagogue and came into the house of Simon and Andrew with James and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Simon’s mother-in-law was lying down, suffering with a fever, and at once they told him about her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came and raised her up by taking hold of her hand, and the fever left her, and she began to serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when it was evening, when the sun had set, they began bringing to him all those who were sick and those who were demon-possessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole town was gathered together at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he healed many who were sick with various diseases and expelled many demons. And he did not permit the demons to speak, because they knew him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And getting up early in the morning while it was very dark, he departed and went to a deserted place, and there he was praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon and those who were with him searched diligently for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they found him and said to him, “Everyone is looking for you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Let us go elsewhere, into the neighboring rural towns, so that I can preach there also, because I have come out for this very reason.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he went into all Galilee preaching in their synagogues and expelling demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a leper came to him, entreating him and kneeling down, saying to him, “If you are willing, you are able to make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And becoming angry, he stretched out his hand and touched him, and said to him, “I am willing; be made clean.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And immediately the leprosy went away from him and he was made clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And warning him sternly, he sent him away at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “See to it that you say nothing to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest and bring for your cleansing the things which Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But he went out and began to proclaim it freely and to spread abroad the account, so that he was no longer able to enter publicly into a town. But he was staying outside in deserted places, and they were coming to him from all directions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he entered again into Capernaum after some days, it became known that he was at home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many had gathered, so that there was no longer room, not even at the door, and he was speaking the word to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came bringing to him a paralytic, carried by four of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were not able to bring him to him because of the crowd, they removed the roof where he was. And after digging through, they lowered the stretcher on which the paralytic was lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Child, your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now some of the scribes were sitting there and reasoning in their hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why does this man speak like this? He is blaspheming! Who is able to forgive sins except God alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately Jesus, perceiving in his spirit that they were reasoning like this within themselves, said to them, “Why are you considering these things in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Which is easier to say to the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say ‘Get up and pick up your stretcher and walk’?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,”—he said to the paralytic—
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “I say to you, get up, pick up your stretcher, and go to your home.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he got up and immediately picked up his stretcher and went out in front of them all, so that they were all amazed and glorified God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went out again beside the sea, and all the crowd was coming to him, and he began to teach them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was passing by, he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax booth, and he said to him, “Follow me!” And he stood up and followed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And it happened that he was dining in his house, and many tax collectors and sinners were dining with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many and they were following him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribes of the Pharisees, when they saw that he was eating with sinners and tax collectors, began to say to his disciples, “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus heard it, he said to them, “Those who are healthy do not have need of a physician, but those who are sick. I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting, and they came and said to him, “Why do the disciples of John and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples do not fast?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “The bridegroom’s attendants are not able to fast while the bridegroom is with them, are they? As long a time as they have the bridegroom with them, they are not able to fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But days will come when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast in that day.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No one sews a patch of unshrunken cloth on an old garment. Otherwise the patch pulls away from it—the new from the old—and the tear becomes worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one puts new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise the wine will burst the wineskins and the wine is destroyed and the wineskins too. But new wine is put into new wineskins.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And it happened that he was going through the grain fields on the Sabbath, and his disciples began to make their way while plucking off the heads of grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisees began to say to him, “Behold, why are they doing what is not permitted on the Sabbath?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Have you never read what David did when he had need and he and those who were with him were hungry—
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: how he entered into the house of God in the time of Abiathar the high priest and ate the bread of the presentation, which it is not permitted to eat (except the priests) and also gave it to those who were with him?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he said to them, “The Sabbath was established for people, and not people for the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So then, the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he entered into the synagogue again, and a man who had a withered hand was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were watching him closely to see if he would heal him on the Sabbath, in order that they could accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to the man who had the withered hand, “Come into the middle.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Is it permitted on the Sabbath to do good or to do evil, to save life or to kill?” But they were silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And looking around at them with anger, grieved at the hardness of their hearts, he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” And he stretched it out, and his hand was restored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisees went out immediately with the Herodians and began to conspire against him with regard to how they could destroy him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went away with his disciples to the sea, and a great crowd from Galilee followed him. And from Judea
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Jerusalem and from Idumea and the other side of the Jordan and around Tyre and Sidon a great crowd came to him because they heard all that he was doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he told his disciples that a small boat should stand ready for him because of the crowd, so that they would not press upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he had healed many, so that all those who were suffering from diseases pressed about him in order that they could touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the unclean spirits, whenever they saw him, were falling down before him and crying out, saying, “You are the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he warned them strictly that they should not make him known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went up on the mountain and summoned those whom he wanted, and they came to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he appointed twelve, so that they would be with him and so that he could send them out to preach
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to have authority to expel demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he appointed the twelve. And to Simon he gave the name Peter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and James the son of Zebedee and John the brother of James (and he gave to them the name Boanerges, that is, “Sons of Thunder”),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Zealot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went home, and the crowd gathered again, so that they were not even able to eat a meal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his family heard this, they went out to restrain him, for they were saying, “He has lost his mind!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribes who had come down from Jerusalem were saying, “He is possessed by Beelzebul!” and “By the ruler of the demons he expels the demons!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called them to himself and was speaking to them in parables, “How can Satan expel Satan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom is not able to stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a house is divided against itself, that house will not be able to stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if Satan has risen up against himself and is divided, he is not able to stand, but is at an end!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But no one is able to enter into the house of a strong man and plunder his property unless he first ties up the strong man, and then he can thoroughly plunder his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly I say to you that all the sins and the blasphemies will be forgiven the sons of men, however much they blaspheme.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit does not have forgiveness forever, but is guilty of an eternal sin”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they were saying, “He has an unclean spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his mother and his brothers arrived, and standing outside, they sent word to him to summon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a crowd was sitting around him, and they told him, “Behold, your mother and your brothers are outside looking for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered them and said, “Who is my mother or my brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And looking around at those who were sitting around him in a circle, he said, “Behold, my mother and my brothers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever does the will of God, this person is my brother and sister and mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he began to teach beside the sea, and a very large crowd was gathered to him, so that he got into a boat and sat on the sea, and the whole crowd was at the sea on the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to teach them many things in parables, and was saying to them in his teaching,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen! Behold, the sower went out to sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that while he was sowing, some seed fell on the side of the path, and the birds came and devoured it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And other seed fell on the rocky ground where it did not have much soil, and it sprang up at once, because it did not have any depth of soil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the sun rose it was scorched, and because it did not have enough root, it withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And other seed fell among the thorn plants, and the thorn plants came up and choked it, and it did not produce grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And other seed fell on the good soil, and produced grain, coming up and increasing, and it bore a crop—one thirty and one sixty and one a hundred times as much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was alone, those around him together with the twelve began asking him about the parables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “To you has been granted the secret of the kingdom of God, but to those who are outside everything is in parables,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that
‘they may look closely and not perceive,
    and they may listen carefully and not understand,
lest they turn and it be forgiven them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Do you not understand this parable? And how will you understand all the parables?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sower sows the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are the ones beside the path where the word is sown, and whenever they hear it, immediately Satan comes and takes away the word that was sown in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are like the ones sown on the rocky ground, who whenever they hear the word immediately receive it with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they have no root in themselves, but are temporary. Then when affliction or persecution comes because of the word, immediately they fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And others are the ones sown among the thorn plants—these are the ones who hear the word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the cares of the world and the deceitfulness of wealth and the desires for other things come in and choke the word and it becomes unproductive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those are the ones sown on the good soil, who hear the word and receive it and bear fruit—one thirty and one sixty and one a hundred times as much.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Surely a lamp is not brought so that it may be put under a bushel basket or under a bed, is it? Is it not so that it may be put on a lampstand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nothing is secret except so that it may be revealed, nor has become hidden except so that it will come to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Take care what you hear! With the measure by which you measure out, it will be measured out to you, and will be added to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever has, more will be given to him, and whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “The kingdom of God is like this: like a man scatters seed on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sleeps and gets up, night and day, and the seed sprouts and grows—he does not know how.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By itself the soil produces a crop: first the grass, then the head of grain, then the full grain in the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the crop permits, he sends in the sickle right away, because the harvest has come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “With what can we compare the kingdom of God, or by what parable can we present it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a mustard seed that when sown on the ground, although it is the smallest of all the seeds that are on the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when it is sown it grows up and becomes the largest of all the garden herbs, and sends out large branches so that the birds of the sky are able to nest in its shade.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with many parables such as these he was speaking the word to them, as they were able to hear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he did not speak to them without a parable, but in private he explained everything to his own disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on that day, when it was evening, he said to them, “Let us cross over to the other side.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And leaving the crowd, they took him along, as he was, in the boat. And other boats were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a great storm of wind developed, and the waves were breaking into the boat, so that the boat was already being filled with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was in the stern sleeping on the cushion, and they woke him up and said to him, “Teacher, is it not a concern to you that we are perishing?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he woke up and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Be quiet! Be silent!” And the wind abated and there was a great calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Why are you fearful? Do you not yet have faith?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were terribly frightened and began to say to one another, “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to the other side of the sea, to the region of the Gerasenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was getting out of the boat, immediately from the tombs a man with an unclean spirit went to meet him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who lived among the tombs. And no one was able to bind him any longer, not even with a chain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he had often been bound with shackles and chains, and the chains had been torn apart by him, and the shackles had been shattered. And no one was strong enough to subdue him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And during every night and day among the tombs and on the mountains he was crying out and cutting himself with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and knelt down before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And crying out with a loud voice he said, “What have I to do with you, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I implore you by God, do not torment me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For he was saying to him, “Come out of the man, unclean spirit!”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was asking him “What is your name?” And he said to him, “My name is Legion, because we are many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was imploring him many times that he would not send them out of the region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a large herd of pigs was there at the hill feeding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they implored him, saying, “Send us to the pigs so that we may enter into them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he permitted them. And the unclean spirits came out and entered into the pigs, and the herd—about two thousand—rushed headlong down the steep slope into the sea and were drowned in the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their herdsmen fled and reported it in the town and in the countryside, and they came to see what it was that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Jesus and saw the demon-possessed man sitting there clothed and in his right mind—the one who had had the legion—and they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who had seen it described to them what had happened to the demon-possessed man, and about the pigs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to urge him to depart from their region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was getting into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed began to implore him that he could go with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he did not permit him, but said to him, “Go to your home to your people and tell them all that the Lord has done for you, and that he has had mercy on you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went away and began to proclaim in the Decapolis all that Jesus had done for him, and they were all astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after Jesus had crossed over again in the boat to the other side, a large crowd gathered to him, and he was beside the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of the rulers of the synagogue came—Jairus by name—and when he saw him, he fell down at his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was imploring him many times, saying, “My little daughter is at the point of death! Come, lay your hands on her, so that she will get well and will live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went with him, and a large crowd was following him and pressing around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a woman who was suffering from hemorrhages twelve years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she had endured many things under many physicians, and had spent all that she had and had received no help at all, but instead became worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she heard about Jesus, she came up in the crowd behind him and touched his cloak,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for she was saying, “If I touch just his clothing, I will be healed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately her hemorrhage stopped and she realized in her body that she was healed of her suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately Jesus, perceiving in himself that power had gone out from himself, turned around in the crowd and said, “Who touched my clothing?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples said to him, “You see the crowd pressing upon you, and you say ‘Who touched me?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was looking around to see the one who had done this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the woman, frightened and trembling, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell down before him and told him the whole truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to her, “Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace and be well from your suffering.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, they came from the synagogue ruler’s house saying, “Your daughter has died. Why trouble the Teacher further?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, ignoring what was said, told the ruler of the synagogue, “Do not be afraid—only believe!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he did not allow anyone to follow along with him except Peter and James and John, the brother of James.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to the house of the ruler of the synagogue and saw a commotion, and people weeping and wailing loudly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he entered, he said to them, “Why are you agitated and weeping? The child is not dead, but is sleeping.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began laughing at him. But he sent them all out and took along the father and mother of the child, and those who were with him, and went in to where the child was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And taking hold of the child’s hand, he said to her, “Talitha koum!” (which is translated, “Little girl, I say to you, get up!”),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and immediately the girl stood up and began walking around (for she was twelve years old). And immediately they were utterly and completely astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded them strictly that no one should learn of this, and said to give her something to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went out from there and came to his hometown, and his disciples followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Sabbath came, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many who heard him were amazed, saying, “Where did this man get these things? And what is this wisdom that has been granted to this man, and the miracles such as these performed through his hands?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary and brother of James and Joses and Judas and Simon? And are not his sisters here with us?” And they were offended by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his hometown, and among his relatives, and in his own household.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was not able to do any miracle in that place except to lay his hands on a few sick people and heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he was astonished because of their unbelief.
And he was going around among the villages teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he summoned the twelve and began to send them out two by two, and gave them authority over the unclean spirits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded them that they take along nothing for the journey except only a staff—no bread, no traveler’s bag, no money in their belts—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to put on sandals and not to wear two tunics.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Whenever you enter into a house, stay there until you depart from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever place does not welcome you or listen to you, as you go out from there, shake off the dust that is on your feet for a testimony against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went out and proclaimed that people should repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were expelling many demons and anointing many sick people with olive oil and healing them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And King Herod heard it, because his name had become known. And they were saying, “John, the one who baptizes, has been raised from the dead, and because of this these miraculous powers are at work in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But others were saying, “He is Elijah,” and others were saying, “He is a prophet like one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod heard it, he said, “John whom I beheaded—this one has been raised!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Herod himself had sent and arrested John and bound him in prison because of Herodias, the wife of Philip his brother, because he had married her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John had been saying to Herod, “It is not permitted for you to have your brother’s wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Herodias held a grudge against him and was wanting to kill him, and was not able to do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Herod was afraid of John, because he knew him to be a righteous and holy man and protected him. And when he listened to him, he was greatly perplexed, and yet he listened to him gladly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a suitable day came when Herod, on his birthday, gave a banquet for his courtiers and military tribunes and the most prominent men of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the daughter of Herodias herself came in and danced and pleased Herod and his dinner guests, the king said to the girl, “Ask me for whatever you want, and I will give it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he swore to her, “Anything whatever you ask me for I will give you, up to half my kingdom!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she went out and said to her mother, “What should I ask for?” And she said, “The head of John the baptizer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she came in immediately with haste to the king and asked, saying, “I want you to give me the head of John the Baptist on a platter immediately.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And although he was deeply grieved, the king, because of his oaths and dinner guests, did not want to refuse her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately the king sent an executioner and ordered him to bring his head. And he went and beheaded him in the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought his head on a platter and gave it to the girl, and the girl gave it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his disciples heard this, they came and took away his corpse and placed it in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the apostles regathered to Jesus and reported to him everything that they had done and that they had taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “You yourselves come privately to an isolated place and rest for a short time.” For those who were coming and going were many, and they did not even have time to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went away in the boat to an isolated place by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many people saw them leaving and recognized them, and ran there together by land from all the towns, and arrived ahead of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And getting out of the boat he saw the large crowd and had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd, and he began to teach them many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hour had already become late when his disciples came up to him, saying, “The place is desolate and the hour is already late.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send them away so that they can go into the surrounding farms and villages and purchase something to eat for themselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said to them, “You give them something to eat.” And they said to him, “Should we go and purchase bread for two hundred denarii and give it to them to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go look!” And when they found out, they said, “Five, and two fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he ordered them all to recline in groups on the green grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they reclined in groups, by hundreds and by fifties.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke the loaves and gave them to his disciples so that they could set them before them. And he distributed the two fish to them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all ate and were satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they picked up the broken pieces, twelve baskets full, and of the fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who ate the loaves were five thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately he made his disciples get into the boat and go on ahead to the other side, to Bethsaida, while he himself dismissed the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he had said farewell to them, he went away to the mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when evening came, the boat was in the middle of the sea and he was alone on the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he saw them being beaten in their rowing because the wind was against them. Around the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea, and he was wanting to pass by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they saw him walking on the sea, they thought that it was a ghost, and they cried out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they all saw him and were terrified. But immediately he spoke with them and said to them, “Have courage, I am he! Do not be afraid!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went up with them into the boat, and the wind abated. And they were extraordinarily astounded within themselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they did not understand concerning the loaves, but their hearts were hardened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret and anchored there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were getting out of the boat, people recognized him immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ran about through that whole region and began to carry around those who were sick on stretchers, wherever they heard that he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And wherever he would go, into villages or into towns or to farms, they would put those who were sick in the marketplaces and would implore him that if they could touch even the edge of his cloak. And all those who touched it were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisees and some of the scribes who had come from Jerusalem gathered to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they saw that some of his disciples were eating their bread with unclean—that is, unwashed—hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they wash their hands ritually, thus holding fast to the traditions of the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they come from the marketplace, they do not eat unless they wash. And there are many other traditions which they have received and hold fast to—for example, the washing of cups and pitchers and bronze kettles and dining couches.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisees and the scribes asked him, “Why do your disciples not live according to the tradition of the elders, but eat their bread with unclean hands?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he said to them, “Isaiah prophesied correctly about you hypocrites, as it is written,
‘This people honors me with their lips,
    but their heart is far, far away from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they worship me in vain,
    teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abandoning the commandment of God, you hold fast to the tradition of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “You splendidly ignore the commandment of God so that you can keep your tradition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘The one who speaks evil of father or mother must certainly die.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say, ‘If a man says to his father or to his mother, “Whatever benefit you would have received from me is corban” (that is, a gift to God),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you no longer permit him to do anything for his father or his mother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thus making void the word of God by your tradition that you have handed down, and you do many similar things such as this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And summoning the crowd again, he said to them, “Listen to me, all of you, and understand:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is nothing outside of a person that is able to defile him by going into him. But the things that go out of a person are the things that defile a person.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he entered into the house away from the crowd, his disciples asked him about the parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “So are you also without understanding? Do you not understand that everything that is outside that goes into a person is not able to defile him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it does not enter into his heart but into his stomach, and goes out into the latrine”—thus declaring all foods clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “What comes out of a person, that defiles a person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from within, from the heart of people, come evil plans, sexual immoralities, thefts, murders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: adulteries, acts of greed, malicious deeds, deceit, licentiousness, envy, abusive speech, pride, foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these evil things come from within and defile a person.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from there he set out and went to the region of Tyre. And when he entered into a house, he wanted no one to know, and yet he was not able to escape notice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But immediately a woman whose young daughter was possessed by an unclean spirit, when she heard about him, came and fell down at his feet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the woman was a Greek—a Syrophoenician by nationality—and she was asking him that he would expel the demon from her daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, “Let the children be satisfied first, for it is not right to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she answered and said to him, “Lord, even the dogs under the table eat the children’s crumbs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, “Because of this statement, go! The demon has gone out of your daughter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she went to her home, she found the child lying on the bed and the demon gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he went away from the region of Tyre and came through Sidon to the Sea of Galilee, within the region of the Decapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought to him a man who was deaf and had difficulty speaking, and they were imploring him that he would place his hand on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took him away from the crowd by himself and put his fingers into his ears, and after spitting, he touched his tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And looking up to heaven, he sighed and said to him, “Ephphatha!” (that is, “Be opened!”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his ears were opened and his difficulty in speaking was removed and he began to speak normally.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he ordered them that they should say nothing, but as much as he ordered them not to, they proclaimed it even more instead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were amazed beyond all measure, saying, “He has done all things well! He even makes the deaf hear and the mute speak!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days there was again a large crowd, and they did not have anything they could eat. Summoning the disciples, he said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have compassion on the crowd, because they have remained with me three days already and do not have anything to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I send them away hungry to their homes they will give out on the way, and some of them have come from far away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples answered him, “Where is anyone able to feed these people with bread here in the desert?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he asked them, “How many loaves do you have?” So they said, “Seven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded the crowd to recline for a meal on the ground, and taking the seven loaves, after he had given thanks he broke them and began giving them to his disciples so that they could set them before them. And they set them before the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they had a few small fish, and after giving thanks for them, he said to set these before them also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they ate and were satisfied, and they picked up the broken pieces that were left, seven baskets full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were about four thousand. And he sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately he got into the boat with his disciples and went to the district of Dalmanutha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisees came and began to argue with him, demanding from him a sign from heaven in order to test him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sighing deeply in his spirit, he said, “Why does this generation demand a sign? Truly I say to you, no sign will be given to this generation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he left them, got into the boat again, and went to the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they had forgotten to take bread, and except for one loaf, they did not have any with them in the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he ordered them, saying, “Watch out! Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the leaven of Herod!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to discuss with one another that they had no bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And knowing this, he said to them, “Why are you discussing that you have no bread? Do you not yet perceive or understand? Have your hearts been hardened?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although you have eyes, do you not see? And although you have ears, do you not hear? And do you not remember?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand how many baskets full of broken pieces did you pick up?” They said to him, “Twelve.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When I also broke the seven loaves for the four thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you pick up?” And they said to him, “Seven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Do you not yet understand?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Bethsaida. And they brought to him a blind man and implored him that he would touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took hold of the blind man’s hand and led him outside the village, and after spitting in his eyes, he placed his hands on him and asked him, “Do you see anything?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And looking up he said, “I see people, for I see them like trees walking around.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he placed his hands on his eyes again, and he opened his eyes and was cured, and could see everything clearly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent him to his home, saying, “Do not even go into the village.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus and his disciples went out to the villages of Caesarea Philippi, and on the way he asked his disciples, saying to them, “Who do people say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they told him, saying, “John the Baptist, and others Elijah, and others that you are one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he asked them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered and said to him, “You are the Christ!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he warned them that they should tell no one about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to teach them that it was necessary for the Son of Man to suffer many things and to be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes, and to be killed, and after three days to rise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was speaking openly about the subject, and Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But turning around and seeing his disciples, he rebuked Peter and said, “Get behind me, Satan, because you are not setting your mind on the things of God, but the things of people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And summoning the crowd together with his disciples, he said to them, “If anyone wants to come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life on account of me and of the gospel will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what does it benefit a person to gain the whole world and forfeit his life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what can a person give in exchange for his life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever is ashamed of me and my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will also be ashamed of him when he comes in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Truly I say to you, that there are some of those standing here who will never experience death until they see the kingdom of God having come with power.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after six days, Jesus took along Peter and James and John, and led them to a high mountain by themselves alone. And he was transfigured before them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his clothing became radiant—extremely white, like no cloth refiner on earth can make so white.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Elijah appeared to them together with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter answered and said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good that we are here! And let us make three shelters, one for you and one for Moses and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For he did not know what he should answer, because they were terrified.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a cloud came, overshadowing them, and a voice came from the cloud, “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly, looking around, they no longer saw anyone with them but Jesus alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were coming down from the mountain, he ordered them that they should tell no one the things that they had seen, except when the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they kept the matter to themselves, discussing what this rising from the dead meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked him, saying, “Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Elijah indeed does come first and restores all things. And how is it written concerning the Son of Man that he should suffer many things and be treated with contempt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you that indeed Elijah has come, and they did to him whatever they wanted, just as it is written about him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to the disciples, they saw a large crowd around them and scribes arguing with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately the whole crowd, when they saw him, were amazed, and ran up to him and greeted him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he asked them, “What are you arguing about with them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one individual from the crowd answered him, “Teacher, I brought to you my son who has a spirit that makes him mute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whenever it seizes him, it throws him down and he foams at the mouth and grinds his teeth and becomes paralyzed. And I told your disciples that they should expel it, and they were not able to do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered them and said, “O unbelieving generation! How long will I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring him to me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought him to him. And when he saw him, the spirit immediately convulsed him, and falling on the ground, he began to roll around, foaming at the mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he asked his father how long it was since this had been happening to him. And he said, “From childhood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And often it has thrown him both into fire and into water, in order that it could destroy him. But if you are able to do anything, have compassion on us and help us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “If you are able! All things are possible for the one who believes!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the father of the child cried out and said, “I believe! Help my unbelief!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus saw that a crowd was running together, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to it, “Mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him, and enter into him no more!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came out, screaming and convulsing him greatly, and he became as if he were dead, so that most of them said, “He has died!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus took hold of his hand and raised him up, and he stood up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he had entered into the house, his disciples asked him privately, “Why were we not able to expel it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “This kind can come out by nothing except by prayer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from there they went out and passed through Galilee. And he did not want anyone to know,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he was teaching his disciples and was telling them, “The Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of men, and they will kill him. And when he is killed, after three days he will rise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not understand the statement, and they were afraid to ask him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Capernaum. And after he was in the house, he asked them, “What were you discussing on the way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were silent, because they had argued with one another on the way about who was greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sat down and called the twelve and said to them, “If anyone wants to be first, he will be last of all and servant of all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took a young child and had him stand among them. And taking him in his arms, he said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever welcomes one of the young children such as these in my name welcomes me, and whoever welcomes me does not welcome me, but the one who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John said to him, “Teacher, we saw someone expelling demons in your name, and we tried to prevent him because he was not following us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Do not prevent him, because there is no one who does a miracle in my name and will be able soon afterward to speak evil of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever is not against us is for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever gives you a cup of water to drink in my name because you are Christ’s, truly I say to you that he will never lose his reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it is better for him if instead a large millstone is placed around his neck and he is thrown into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your hand causes you to sin, cut it off! It is better for you to enter into life crippled than, having two hands, to go into hell—into the unquenchable fire!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your foot causes you to sin, cut it off! It is better for you to enter into life lame than, having two feet, to be thrown into hell!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your eye causes you to sin, tear it out! It is better for you to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye than, having two eyes, to be thrown into hell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘where their worm does not die and the fire is not extinguished.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone will be salted with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salt is good, but if the salt becomes deprived of its salt content, by what can you make it salty? Have salt among yourselves, and be at peace with one another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from there he set out and came to the region of Judea and the other side of the Jordan, and again crowds came together to him. And again, as he was accustomed to do, he began to teach them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked him if it was permitted for a man to divorce his wife, in order to test him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said to them, “What did Moses command you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said, “Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of divorce and to send her away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “He wrote this commandment for you because of your hardness of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from the beginning of creation ‘he made them male and female.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this a man will leave his father and mother and will be joined to his wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two will become one flesh,’ so that they are no longer two but one flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore what God has joined together, man must not separate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the house again the disciples began to ask him about this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if she divorces her husband and marries another, she commits adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were bringing young children to him so that he could touch them, but the disciples rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus saw it, he was indignant, and said to them, “Let the young children come to me. Do not forbid them, for to such belongs the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, whoever does not welcome the kingdom of God like a young child will never enter into it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after taking them into his arms, he blessed them, placing his hands on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was setting out on his way, one individual ran up and knelt down before him and asked him, “Good Teacher, what must I do so that I will inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except God alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments: ‘Do not murder, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not give false testimony, do not defraud, honor your father and mother.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “Teacher, all these I have observed from my youth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, looking at him, loved him, and said to him, “You lack one thing: Go, sell all that you have, and give the proceeds to the poor—and you will have treasure in heaven—and come, follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he looked gloomy at the statement and went away sorrowful, because he had many possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus looked around and said to his disciples, “How difficult it is for those who possess wealth to enter into the kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples were astounded at his words. But Jesus answered and said to them again, “Children, how difficult it is to enter into the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter into the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were very astounded, saying to one another, “And who can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked at them and said, “With human beings it is impossible, but not with God. For all things are possible with God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter began to say to him, “Behold, we have left everything and followed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Truly I say to you, there is no one who has left house or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or fields on account of me and on account of the gospel
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will not receive a hundred times as much now in this time—houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and fields, together with persecutions—and in the age to come, eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they were on the road going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus was going on ahead of them. And they were astounded, but those who were following him were afraid. And taking aside the twelve again, he began to tell them the things that were about to happen to him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and the scribes, and they will condemn him to death and will hand him over to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will mock him and spit on him and flog him and kill him, and after three days he will rise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came up to him and said to him, “Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we ask you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “What do you want that I do for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to him, “Grant to us that we may sit one at your right hand and one at your left in your glory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “You do not know what you are asking! Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, or to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “We are able.” So Jesus said to them, “You will drink the cup that I drink, and you will be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to sit at my right hand or at my left is not mine to grant, but is for those for whom it has been prepared.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard this, the ten began to be indignant about James and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus called them to himself and said to them, “You know that those who are considered to rule over the Gentiles lord it over them, and their people in high positions exercise authority over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is not like this among you! But whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whoever wants to be most prominent among you must be the slave of all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Jericho. And as he was setting out from Jericho along with his disciples and a large crowd, a blind beggar, Bartimaeus the son of Timaeus, was sitting beside the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out and say, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many people warned him that he should be quiet. But he was crying out even more loudly, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus stopped and said, “Call him.” And they called the blind man and said to him, “Have courage! Get up! He is calling you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he threw off his cloak, jumped up, and came to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered him and said, “What do you want me to do for you?” And the blind man said to him, “Rabboni, that I may regain my sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Go, your faith has healed you.” And immediately he regained his sight and began to follow him on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came near to Jerusalem, to Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Go into the village before you, and right away as you enter into it you will find a colt tied, on which no one has ever sat. Untie it and bring it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if anyone says to you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say ‘The Lord has need of it, and will send it here again at once.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went away and found a colt tied at a door outside in the street, and they untied it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of those who were standing there said to them, “What are you doing, untying the colt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they told them, just as Jesus had said, and they allowed them to take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought the colt to Jesus and threw their cloaks over it, and he sat on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many people spread their cloaks on the road, and others spread leafy branches they had cut from the fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And those who went ahead and those who were following were shouting,
“Hosanna!
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David!
    Hosanna in the highest heaven!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went into Jerusalem to the temple, and after looking around at everything, because the hour was already late, he went out to Bethany with the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the next day as they were departing from Bethany, he was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw from a distance a fig tree that had leaves, he went to see if perhaps he would find anything on it. And when he came up to it he found nothing except leaves, because it was not the season for figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he responded and said to it, “Let no one eat fruit from you any more forever!” And his disciples heard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Jerusalem. And he entered into the temple courts and began to drive out those who were selling and those who were buying in the temple courts, and overturned the tables of the money changers and the chairs of those who were selling doves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he did not permit anyone to carry objects through the temple courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he began to teach and was saying to them, “Is it not written,
‘My house will be called a house of prayer
    for all the nations,’
but you have made it a cave of robbers!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief priests and the scribes heard it, and began considering how they could destroy him. For they were afraid of him because the whole crowd was astounded by his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when evening came they went out of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they passed by early in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter remembered and said to him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree that you cursed has withered!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them, “Have faith in God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you that whoever says to this mountain, ‘Be lifted up and thrown into the sea!’ and does not doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says will happen, it will be done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I say to you, whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received it, and it will be done for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whenever you stand praying, if you have anything against anyone, forgive him, so that your Father who is in heaven will also forgive you your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came again to Jerusalem. And as he was walking in the temple courts, the chief priests and the scribes and the elders came up to him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “By what authority are you doing these things, or who gave you this authority that you do these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question. Answer me and I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The baptism of John—was it from heaven or from men? Answer me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to discuss this with one another, saying, “What should we say? If we say ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From men’”—they were afraid of the crowd, because they all looked upon John as truly a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they replied to Jesus saying, “We do not know.” And Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to speak to them in parables: “A man planted a vineyard, and put a fence around it, and dug a trough for the winepress, and built a watchtower, and leased it to tenant farmers, and went on a journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent a slave to the tenant farmers at the proper time, so that he could collect some of the fruit of the vineyard from the tenant farmers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they seized him and beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he sent to them another slave, and that one they struck on the head and dishonored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent another, and that one they killed. And he sent many others, some of whom they beat and some of whom they killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had one more, a beloved son. Last of all he sent him to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those tenant farmers said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him and the inheritance will be ours!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they seized and killed him and threw him out of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the tenant farmers and give the vineyard to others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not read this scripture:
‘The stone which the builders rejected,
    this has become the cornerstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This came about from the Lord,
    and it is marvelous in our eyes’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were seeking to arrest him, and they were afraid of the crowd, because they knew that he had told the parable with reference to them. And they left him and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sent some of the Pharisees and the Herodians to him so that they could catch him unawares in a statement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came, they said to him, “Teacher, we know that you are truthful and you do not care what anyone thinks, because you do not regard the opinion of people but teach the way of God in truth. Is it permitted to pay taxes to Caesar or not? Should we pay or should we not pay?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because he knew their hypocrisy, he said to them, “Why are you testing me? Bring me a denarius so that I can look at it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought one. And he said to them, “Whose image and inscription is this?” And they said to him, “Caesar’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “Give to Caesar the things of Caesar, and to God the things of God!” And they were utterly amazed at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sadducees—who say there is no resurrection—came up to him and began to ask him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if someone’s brother dies and he leaves behind a wife and does not leave a child, that his brother should take the wife and father descendants for his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were seven brothers, and the first took a wife. And when he died, he did not leave descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the second took her, and he died without leaving descendants. And the third likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the seven did not leave descendants. Last of all the woman also died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be? For the seven had her as wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Are you not deceived because of this, because you do not know the scriptures or the power of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning the dead, that they are raised, have you not read in the book of Moses in the passage about the bush how God spoke to him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not God of the dead, but of the living. You are very much mistaken!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of the scribes came up and heard them debating. When he saw that he answered them well, he asked him, “Which commandment is the most important of all?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “The most important is, ‘Listen, Israel! The Lord our God, the Lord is one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall love the Lord your God from your whole heart and from your whole soul and from your whole mind and from your whole strength.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second is this: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribe said to him, “That is true, Teacher. You have said correctly that he is one and there is no other except him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to love him from your whole heart and from your whole understanding and from your whole strength, and to love your neighbor as yourself, is much more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, when he saw that he had answered thoughtfully, said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” And no one dared to put a question to him any longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And continuing, Jesus said while teaching in the temple courts, “How can the scribes say that the Christ is David’s son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David himself said by the Holy Spirit,
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
    “Sit at my right hand,
until I put your enemies
    under your feet.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David himself calls him ‘Lord,’ and how is he his son?” And the large crowd was listening to him gladly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in his teaching he said, “Beware of the scribes, who like walking around in long robes and greetings in the marketplaces
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the best seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who devour the houses of widows and pray lengthy prayers for the sake of appearance. These will receive more severe condemnation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sat down opposite the contribution box and was observing how the crowd was putting coins into the contribution box. And many rich people were putting in many coins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one poor widow came and put in two small copper coins (that is, a penny).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And summoning his disciples, he said to them, “Truly I say to you that this poor widow put in more than all those who put offerings into the contribution box.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they all contributed out of their abundance, but she out of her poverty put in everything she had, her whole means of subsistence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was going out of the temple courts, one of his disciples said to him, “Teacher, look! What great stones and what wonderful buildings!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Do you see these great buildings? Not one stone will be left here on another stone that will not be thrown down!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell us, when will these things happen, and what will be the sign when all these things are about to be accomplished?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus began to say to them, “Watch out that no one deceives you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and they will deceive many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you hear about wars and rumors of wars, do not be alarmed. This must happen, but the end is not yet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nation will rise up against nation and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places. There will be famines. These things are the beginning of birth pains.
verses.speaker: Narrator
