verses.text: “But you, watch out for yourselves! They will hand you over to councils and you will be beaten in the synagogues and will have to stand before governors and kings because of me, for a witness to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the gospel must first be proclaimed to all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they arrest you and hand you over, do not be anxious beforehand what you should say, but whatever is given to you at that hour, say this. For you are not the ones who are speaking, but the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And brother will hand over brother to death, and a father his child, and children will rise up against parents and have them put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will be hated by all because of my name. But the one who endures to the end—this one will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when you see the abomination of desolation standing where it should not be” (let the one who reads understand), “then those in Judea must flee to the mountains!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who is on his housetop must not come down or go inside to take anything out of his house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the one who is in the field must not turn back to pick up his cloak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing their babies in those days!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But pray that it will not happen in winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in those days there will be tribulation of such a kind as has not happened from the beginning of the creation that God created until now, and never will happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the Lord had not shortened the days, no human being would be saved. But for the sake of the elect, whom he chose, he has shortened the days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And at that time if anyone should say to you, “Behold, here is the Christ,’ ‘Behold, there he is,’ do not believe him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For false messiahs and false prophets will appear, and will produce signs and wonders in order to mislead, if possible, the elect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you, watch out! I have told you everything ahead of time!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But in those days, after that tribulation,
‘the sun will be darkened
    and the moon will not give its light,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and the stars will be falling from heaven,
    and the powers in the heavens will be shaken.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then they will see the Son of Man arriving in the clouds with great power and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then he will send out the angels, and will gather the elect together from the four winds, from the end of the earth to the end of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now learn the parable from the fig tree: Whenever its branch has already become tender and puts forth its leaves, you know that summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also you, when you see these things happening, know that he is near, at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you that this generation will never pass away until all these things take place!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But concerning that day or hour no one knows—not even the angels in heaven nor the Son—except the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch out! Be alert, because you do not know when the time is!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a man away on a journey, who left his house and gave his slaves authority—to each one his work—and to the doorkeeper he gave orders that he should be on the alert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be on the alert, for you do not know when the master of the house is coming—whether in the evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or early in the morning—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest he arrive suddenly and find you sleeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what I say to you, I say to everyone: Be on the alert!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after two days it was the Passover and the feast of Unleavened Bread, and the chief priests and the scribes were seeking how, after arresting him by stealth, they could kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they said, “Not at the feast, lest there be an uproar by the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he was at Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he was reclining for a meal, a woman came holding an alabaster flask of very costly perfumed oil of genuine nard. After breaking the alabaster flask, she poured it out on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some were expressing indignation to one another: “Why has there been this waste of perfumed oil?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this perfumed oil could have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor!” And they began to scold her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why do you cause trouble for her? She has done a good deed to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the poor you always have with you, and you can do good for them whenever you want, but you do not always have me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She has done what she could; she has anointed my body beforehand for burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And truly I say to you, wherever the gospel is proclaimed in the whole world, what she has done will also be told in memory of her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went to the chief priests in order to betray him to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard this, they were delighted, and promised to give him money. And he began seeking how he could betray him conveniently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the first day of the feast of Unleavened Bread, when they sacrificed the Passover lamb, his disciples said to him, “Where do you want us to go and prepare, so that you can eat the Passover?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent two of his disciples and said to them, “Go into the city and a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and wherever he enters, say to the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is my guest room where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will show you a large upstairs room furnished and ready, and prepare for us there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples went out and came into the city and found everything just as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was evening, he arrived with the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were reclining at table and eating, Jesus said, “Truly I say to you, that one of you who is eating with me will betray me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to be distressed and to say to him one by one, “Surely not I?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “It is one of the twelve—the one who is dipping bread into the bowl with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man is going just as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for him if that man had not been born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were eating, he took bread and, after giving thanks, he broke it and gave it to them and said, “Take it, this is my body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after taking the cup and giving thanks, he gave it to them, and they all drank from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “This is my blood of the covenant which is poured out for many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you that I will never drink of the fruit of the vine any longer until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had sung the hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Jesus said to them, “You will all fall away, because it is written,
‘I will strike the shepherd
    and the sheep will be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I am raised, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said to him, “Even if they all fall away, certainly I will not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Truly I say to you that today—this night—before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he kept saying emphatically, “If it is necessary for me to die with you, I will never deny you!” And they all were saying the same thing also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to a place named Gethsemane, and he said to his disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took along Peter and James and John with him, and he began to be distressed and troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “My soul is deeply grieved, to the point of death. Remain here and stay awake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And going forward a little he fell to the ground and began to pray that, if it were possible, the hour would pass from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible for you! Take away this cup from me! Yet not what I will, but what you will.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came and found them sleeping, and he said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Were you not able to stay awake one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stay awake and pray that you will not enter into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he went away and prayed, saying the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he came and found them sleeping, for they could not keep their eyes open, and they did not know what to reply to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came the third time and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? It is enough! The hour has come. Behold, the Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up, let us go! Behold, the one who is betraying me is approaching!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately, while he was still speaking, Judas—one of the twelve—arrived, and with him a crowd with swords and clubs, from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the one who was betraying him had given them a sign, saying, “The one whom I kiss—he is the one. Arrest him and lead him away under guard!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he arrived, he came up to him immediately and said, “Rabbi,” and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they laid hands on him and arrested him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a certain one of the bystanders, drawing his sword, struck the slave of the high priest and cut off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them, “Have you come out with swords and clubs, as against a robber, to arrest me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every day I was with you in the temple courts teaching, and you did not arrest me! But this has happened in order that the scriptures would be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all abandoned him and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain young man was following him, clothed only in a linen cloth on his naked body. And they attempted to seize him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he left behind the linen cloth and fled naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they led Jesus away to the high priest, and all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes came together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter followed him from a distance, right inside, into the courtyard of the high priest. And he was sitting with the officers and warming himself by the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for testimony against Jesus in order to put him to death, and they did not find it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many gave false testimony against him, and their testimony was not consistent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some stood up and began to give false testimony against him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We heard him saying, ‘I will destroy this temple made by hands, and within three days I will build another not made by hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their testimony was not even consistent about this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the high priest stood up in the midst of them and asked Jesus, saying, “Do you not reply anything? What are these people testifying against you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he was silent and did not reply anything. Again the high priest asked him and said to him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed One?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, “I am, and you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Power and coming with the clouds of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the high priest tore his clothes and said, “What further need do we have of witnesses?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have heard the blasphemy! What do you think?” And they all condemned him as deserving death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some began to spit on him and to cover his face and to strike him with their fists, and to say to him “Prophesy!” And the officers received him with slaps in the face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the female slaves of the high priest came up
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she saw Peter warming himself, she looked intently at him and said, “You also were with the Nazarene, Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it, saying, “I neither know nor understand what you mean!” And he went out into the gateway, and a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the female slave, when she saw him, began to say again to the bystanders, “This man is one of them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it again. And after a little while, again the bystanders began to say to Peter, “You really are one of them, because you also are a Galilean, and your accent shows it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to curse and to swear with an oath, “I do not know this man whom you are talking about!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately a rooster crowed for the second time. And Peter remembered the statement, how Jesus had said to him, “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times,” and throwing himself down, he began to weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as morning came, after formulating a plan, the chief priests, with the elders and scribes and the whole Sanhedrin, tied up Jesus, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?” And he answered him and said, “You say so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief priests began to accuse him of many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate asked him again, saying, “Do you not answer anything? See how many charges they are bringing against you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus did not answer anything further, so that Pilate was astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at each feast he customarily released for them one prisoner whom they requested.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one named Barabbas was imprisoned with the rebels who had committed murder in the rebellion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the crowd came up and began to ask him to do as he customarily did for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate answered them, saying, “Do you want me to release for you the king of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For he realized that the chief priests had handed him over because of envy.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests incited the crowd so that he would release for them Barabbas instead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate answered and said to them again, “Then what do you want me to do with the one whom you call the king of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shouted again, “Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate said to them, “Why? What evil has he done?” But they shouted even louder, “Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate, because he wanted to satisfy the crowd, released for them Barabbas. And after he had Jesus flogged, he handed him over so that he could be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the soldiers led him away into the palace (that is, the governor’s residence) and called together the whole cohort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they put a purple cloak on him, and after weaving a crown of thorns they placed it on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to greet him, “Hail, king of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they repeatedly struck him on the head with a reed, and were spitting on him, and they knelt down and did obeisance to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had mocked him, they stripped him of the purple cloak and put his own clothes on him, and they led him out so that they could crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they forced a certain man who was passing by, Simon of Cyrene (the father of Alexander and Rufus), who was coming from the country, to carry his cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought him to the place Golgotha (which is translated “Place of a Skull”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they attempted to give him wine mixed with myrrh, but he did not take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they crucified him and divided his clothes among themselves by casting lots for them to see who should take what.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was the third hour when they crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the inscription of the charge against him was written, “The king of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with him they crucified two robbers, one on his right and one on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who passed by reviled him, shaking their heads and saying, “Aha! The one who would destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: save yourself by coming down from the cross!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way also the chief priests, along with the scribes, were mocking him to one another, saying, “He saved others; he is not able to save himself!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the Christ, the king of Israel, come down now from the cross, so that we may see and believe! Even those who were crucified with him were reviling him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the sixth hour came, darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” (which is translated, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of the bystanders, when they heard it, said, “Behold, he is summoning Elijah!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And someone ran and filled a sponge with sour wine, put it on a reed, and gave it to him to drink, saying, “Leave him alone! Let us see if Elijah is coming to take him down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus uttered a loud cry and expired.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the centurion who was standing opposite him saw that he expired like this, he said, “Truly this man was God’s Son!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were also women observing from a distance, among whom were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the younger and Joses, and Salome,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who used to follow him and serve him when he was in Galilee, and many other women who went up with him to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was already evening, since it was the day of preparation (that is, the day before the Sabbath),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph of Arimathea, a prominent member of the council who was also himself looking forward to the kingdom of God, came acting courageously and went in to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate was surprised that he was already dead, and summoning the centurion, asked him whether he had died already.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he learned of it from the centurion, he granted the corpse to Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after purchasing a linen cloth and taking him down, he wrapped him in the linen cloth and placed him in a tomb that had been cut from the rock. And he rolled a stone over the entrance of the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses saw where he was placed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome purchased fragrant spices so that they could go and anoint him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And very early in the morning on the first day of the week they came to the tomb after the sun had risen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were saying to one another, “Who will roll away the stone for us from the entrance of the tomb?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they looked up, they saw that the stone had been rolled away (for it was very large).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were going into the tomb, they saw a young man dressed in a white robe sitting on the right side, and they were alarmed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “Do not be alarmed. You are looking for Jesus the Nazarene who was crucified. He has been raised, he is not here! See the place where they laid him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But go, tell his disciples and Peter that he is going ahead of you to Galilee. You will see him there, just as he told you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they went out and fled from the tomb, because trembling and amazement had seized them. And they said nothing to anyone, because they were afraid.
So they promptly reported all the things they had been commanded to those around Peter. And after these things, Jesus himself also sent out through them from the east even as far as the west the holy and imperishable proclamation of eternal salvation. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now early on the first day of the week, after he rose, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had expelled seven demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went out and announced it to those who were with him while they were mourning and weeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those, when they heard that he was alive and had been seen by her, refused to believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after these things, he appeared in a different form to two of them as they were walking, while they were going out into the countryside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these went and reported it to the others, and they did not believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And later, while they were reclining at table, he appeared to the eleven. And he reprimanded their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they did not believe those who had seen him after he had been raised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Go into all the world and preach the gospel to all creation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who believes and is baptized will be saved, but the one who refuses to believe will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these signs will accompany those who believe: in my name they will expel demons, they will speak in new tongues,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they will pick up snakes. And if they drink any deadly poison it will never hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick and they will get well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord Jesus, after he had spoken to them, was taken up into heaven and sat down at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went out and proclaimed everywhere, while the Lord was working together with them and confirming the message through the accompanying signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator
